contentrichtext.text: <noinclude>{{../doc}} {{divhide|Staging area}} ==Images== Use only ONE image at a time <gallery> File:Staffordshire hoard annotated.jpg|Pieces discovered at the Staffordshire Hoard site File:Flickr - portableantiquities - Hilt Fitting.jpg|A sword hilt fitting, gold with cloisonné garnet inlay, from the Staffordshire Hoard (soil can be seen on the object as it has not yet been cleaned by conservators) File:BBC News.svg|BBC News logo </gallery> ==Ineligible== {|class="wikitable" |- !Blurb !Reason |- |'''[[Tynwald Day]]''' on the [[Isle of Man]]; |no footnotes |- | [[1775]] – The [[Second Continental Congress]] of Britain's [[Thirteen Colonies]] adopted the '''[[Olive Branch Petition]]''' in the hopes of avoiding war with Great Britain. | unreferenced section |- |[[1934]] – Police '''[[1934 West Coast waterfront strike|opened fire]]''' on [[Strike action|striking]] longshoremen in [[San Francisco]]. |refimprove |- |[[1950]] – The [[Knesset|Israeli Knesset]] enacted the '''[[Law of Return]]''', granting [[Jews]] around the world the right to migrate to and settle in Israel and gain citizenship. |not neutral |- | [[1987]] – The '''[[Black Tigers]]''' of the [[Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam]] made its first [[suicide attack|suicide bombing]] against the [[Sri Lanka Army]] in [[Nelliady]], Sri Lanka. | {{tl|cn}} tags (relative to article length) |- |[[2009]] – The largest hoard of [[Anglo-Saxon]] gold ever discovered, consisting of more than 1,500 items, '''[[Staffordshire Hoard|was found]]''' near the village of [[Hammerwich]], near [[Lichfield]], in [[Staffordshire]]. | refimprove section |} ==Eligible== {{*mp}} [[1946]] – Named after [[Bikini Atoll]], the site of the [[nuclear weapon]]s test [[Operation Crossroads]] in the [[Marshall Islands]], the modern '''[[bikini]]''' was introduced at a fashion show in [[Paris]]. {{*mp}} [[1954]] – '''[[BBC News]]'''<!-- ''(current logo pictured)''--> aired its first [[news broadcasting|televised news broadcast]] from leased studios within [[Alexandra Palace]] in London. - reference issues {{*mp}} [[1962]] – '''''[[The Late Late Show]]''''', the world's longest-running [[Talk show|chat show]] by the [[Raidió Teilifís Éireann|same broadcaster]], aired on [[Television in Ireland|Irish television]] for the first time. {{*mp}} [[1977]] – General '''[[Muhammad Zia-ul-Haq]]''' overthrew [[Prime Minister of Pakistan|Pakistani Prime Minister]] [[Zulfikar Ali Bhutto]] in a military coup d'état. {{*mp}} [[1989]] – [[United States National Security Council]] member '''[[Oliver North]]''' was sentenced for his part in the [[Iran-Contra Affair]]. {{*mp}} [[2004]] – Indonesia held '''[[Indonesian presidential election, 2004|its first direct presidential elections]]''', that resulted in the election of [[Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono]] as [[President of Indonesia]] after the second round on {{nowrap|September 20.}} {{divhide|end}} </noinclude> '''[[July 5]]''': '''[[Apsis|Aphelion]]''' (14:44 [[Coordinated Universal Time|UTC]], 2013); [[List of national independence days|Independence Day]] in<!-- '''[[Algeria]]''' ([[1962]]),; tagged for expansion--> '''[[Cape Verde]]''' ([[1975]]) and '''[[Venezuela]]''' ([[1811]]); '''[[Saints Cyril and Methodius|Saints Cyril and Methodius Day]]''' in the Czech Republic and Slovakia <div style="float:right;margin-left:0.5em;"> [[Image:Sir Isaac Newton by Sir Godfrey Kneller, Bt.jpg|Isaac Newton|100x100px]] </div> {{*mp}} [[1687]] – The '''''[[Philosophiæ Naturalis Principia Mathematica|Philosophiae<!--don't use ligature to avoid character encoding issues on some clients--> Naturalis Principia Mathematica]]''''' by [[Isaac Newton]] ''(pictured)'' was first published, describing [[Newton's laws of motion|his laws of motion]] and [[Newton's law of universal gravitation|his law of universal gravitation]]. {{*mp}} [[1937]] – The [[Hormel|Hormel Foods Corporation]] introduced '''[[Spam]]''', the [[canning|canned]] precooked meat product that would eventually enter into pop culture, folklore, and urban legend. {{*mp}} [[1950]] – [[Korean War]]: In the first encounter between North Korean and American forces, the unprepared and undisciplined [[United States Army|U.S. Army]] task force '''[[Battle of Osan|was routed]]'''. {{*mp}} [[2006]] – The [[United Nations Security Council]] held an emergency meeting hours after North Korea '''[[2006 North Korean missile test|reportedly tested]]''' at least seven separate [[ballistic missile]]s. {{*mp}} [[2009]] – A series of violent riots '''[[July 2009 Ürümqi riots|broke out]]''' in [[Ürümqi]], the capital city of the [[Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region]] in China. </ul> {{SelAnnivFooter|Month=July|Day=5}}<noinclude> </noinclude>
